definitions.definition: a small area of something, especially one which is different from the area around it

examples.text: a black dog with a white patch on its back
a bald patch on the top of his head
damp patches on the wall
patches of dense fog
We sat in a patch of shade under a tree.
The velvet curtains were faded in patches.
There were some patches of clear blue sky.
Flowers provide little bright patches of colour around the garden.
an isolated patch of forest
icy patches on the roads
located on a small patch of flat ground
This led Nixon into a political briar patch (= a painful situation that is difficult to escape).

definitions.definition: a small piece of material that is used to cover a hole in something or to make a weak area stronger, or as decoration

examples.text: I sewed patches on the knees of my jeans.
She wore a jacket with bright patches sewn onto it.
dancers with patches on their costumes
Students were wearing American flag patches on their sleeves.

definitions.definition: a piece of material that you wear over an eye, usually because the eye is damaged

examples.text: He had a black patch over one eye.

definitions.definition: a piece of material that you sew onto clothes as part of a uniform

examples.text: He wears a patch from his employer, Verizon.
It has a UPS patch sewn on the right shoulder.

definitions.definition: a piece of material that people can wear on their skin to help them to stop smoking

examples.text: nicotine patches

definitions.definition: a small piece of land, especially one used for growing vegetables or fruit

examples.text: a vegetable patch
We had a strawberry patch beside the greenhouse.

definitions.definition: an area that somebody works in, knows well or comes from

examples.text: He knows every house in his patch.
She has had a lot of success in her **home patch**.

definitions.definition: a period of time of the type mentioned, usually a difficult or unhappy one

examples.text: to go through a **bad/difficult/sticky patch**
I was going through a patch of poor health.
Their business hit a sticky patch last year.
The team has been through a rough patch recently.
We did have a patch of bad luck, but we're through it now.

definitions.definition: a small piece of code (= instructions that a computer can understand) which can be added to a computer program to improve it or to correct a fault

examples.text: Follow the instructions below to download and install the patch.
Update and apply all **security patches** to your browser, as soon as possible.

definitions.definition: to be much less good, attractive, etc. than somebody/something else

examples.text: This book isn’t a patch on her others.
Shop-bought jam is not a patch on home-made.

wordOrigin: late Middle English: perhaps from a variant of Old French pieche, dialect variant of piece ‘piece’.
